stats:
You have {0} lines of code, {1} comments and {2} blank lines.

Blank lines are useful to separate code into logical blocks, but be wary of having too many as less code will fit onto the screen at any one time. It makes it harder to de-bug if you have to keep scrolling through the code.

density_feedback.text: Your code appears to have sufficient comments, but you should ensure that the comments are useful and do not simply repeat the code. They should clarify your intent and explain what you are trying to do. It is also bad practice to leave in commented out code that's not used any more.

You could improve the maintability and clarity of your code by including more comments. They should clarify your intent and explain what you are trying to do. They will be very useful for your future self and others when trying to follow your code.
Your code seems to have no comments at all. This is bad practise, both for your sake, and for the sake of others who might interract with your codebase
